definition: lit. by the thousands and tens of thousands (idiom); untold numbers/innumerable/thousands upon thousands

sentences.english: Many spurious claims are made and millions are lost annually on bogus news.
sentences.chinese: 許多僞稱是由千千萬萬的人正在失去每年假消息。

sentences.english: Hundreds of thousands of homes and businesses are in the dark and flights are being cancelled.
sentences.chinese: 千千萬萬棟房屋和商業樓處於黑暗中，航班也被取消。

sentences.english: Many many years later, not much has changed.
sentences.chinese: 千千萬萬年以後，沒有多大的變化。

sentences.english: By then, hundreds of thousands of people in Europe and America to drive home the road reunion.
sentences.chinese: 屆時，千千萬萬的歐美人風塵僕僕地趕回家中團聚。

definition: plural marker for pronouns, and nouns referring to individuals
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
huge/great/grand/worthy of the greatest admiration/important (contribution etc)
to see with one's own eyes/very soon
unimportant/not serious/it doesn't matter/never mind/it looks all right, but
to despair/to give up all hope/desperate/desperation
